item.title: Lucky Pokemon GO Player Gets Second Chance to Catch Rare Legendary Pokemon
item.description:
Highlights

  • Rare encounters with Legendary birds in Pokemon GO are challenging, with high escape rates adding to the difficulty.
  • Players impressed by lucky encounter with Galarian Articuno, sparking envy among those still trying to catch Legendary birds.

A very lucky Pokemon GO player was gifted a second chance when they missed their opportunity to catch a Galarian Articuno. The unexpected Pokemon GO second chance was made even better by finding a version of the bird with superior CP.

Simply encountering a Galarian Legendary bird in Pokemon GO is a challenge in and of itself. The only opportunity players have under normal circumstances to meet these rare Pokemon is to use their Daily Adventure Incense. With only one incense per day and only fifteen minutes of effectiveness, players have to make the absolute most of their time to even have a chance of seeing one of these rare Legendary Pokemon. However, that's just part of the challenge, as the Legendary birds have a high rate of escape from battle, leaving many players empty handed.

Related
Pokemon GO Secretly Removes Shiny Lock From Extremely Rare Pokemon

Niantic makes it possible for players to get shiny variants of some extremely rare Pokemon in the wild, something which wasn't possible earlier.

That looked like it was going to be the case for Pokemon GO player Puzzleheaded-Dish157, who popped their Daily Adventure Incense and were thrilled to discover a Galarian Articuno. The Galarian Articuno had a low CP of just 147, and promptly ran away. However, seven minutes later, another Galarian Articuno popped, this time with a much higher CP of 2494. The player tried again, and this time succeeded in netting the rare Pokemon with a critical catch.

Pokemon GO Players Are Impressed (And Envious)

Fellow Pokemon GO fans were quick to heap congratulations and praise on Puzzleheaded-Dish157, who now only needs to get Galarian Moltres to complete the trio of Legendary Galarian birds. The OP and some commenters joked about the Galarian Articuno they initially encountered being the same one they met later on, but that it had escaped in order to boost its CP so the player would get a better catch.

Others expressed envy or surprise that the Galarian Legendaries were even available with Daily Adventure Incense, as several players still haven't seen them pop up at all. However, as previously mentioned, these encounters are rare to begin with, so it doesn't come as much of a surprise that these birds have yet to make an appearance in some players' games. Unfortunately, some fans have been struck with incredibly bad luck in Pokemon GO , missing multiple catches including during an encounter with Moltres.

If catching the Galarian Legendary birds in Pokemon GO were easy, it wouldn't be as special to actually have them. However, there are probably some fans out there who really wish they had Puzzleheaded-Dish157's luck and got a second chance at catching powerful Pokemon they've missed the opportunity to grab in the past.

item.title: MultiVersus Reveals New Playable Character Ahead of the Game's Full Launch
item.description:
Highlights

  • Banana Guard joins MultiVersus cast with Austen Moret as the voice actor, adding to the game's unique character lineup.
  • MultiVersus surprises players with offline break after beta; full launch nearing with Banana Guard and Joker additions.
  • Banana Guard's trailer showcases new Bruiser class character, hinting at potential interactions with Adventure Time cast in-game.

MultiVersus has announced the Banana Guard as the newest playable character. As well as revealing the addition of the charismatic Adventure Time character to the game's cast, MultiVersus revealed that the character will be voiced by Austen Moret, who has other notable works such as Unicorn Overlord , Mobile Legends Bang Bang , and WWE 2K24 .

MultiVersus became real in 2021, when it was announced a Super Smash Bros. clone starring numerous characters from Warner Bros. properties, such as Looney Tunes and Steven Universe . After the beta was held between 2022 and 2023, MultiVersus surprised players by announcing that it would go offline and return at a later date. Now, MultiVersus ' full launch is getting closer, and to increase the hype, the devs revealed the next fighter to join the 2D platform fighting game.

Related
MultiVersus Teases New Highly Requested Skin

Multiversus reveals yet another promotional video, and it teases that a highly requested skin may finally be on its way to the game.

MultiVersus has announced the addition of Adventure Time 's Banana Guard to the cast of playable characters. In the trailer, the charismatic protector of Princess Bubblegum and Princess Bubblegum's Castle appears striking with his spear and using a dumbbell to become stronger before attacking. A new character from the MultiVersus Bruiser class , the trailer shows Banana Guard alongside Finn the Human and Jake the Dog, the other Adventure Time characters featured in the game. The trailer also shows more Banana Guards gathered together, although it doesn't detail how a potential interaction between the characters will work in the game.

New Joke Character? Banana Guard Announced in MultiVersus

In the announcement trailer, the Banana Guard asks if "he's not like a joke character," referring to one of the funniest aspects of fighting games . In a post on the game's official Twitter account, MultiVersus revealed some of the Banana Guard's attacks. "Potassium and Protein" makes the Banana Guard use the dumbbell to gain damage and knockback, and with "Banana Split," the character falls to the ground, causing damage to enemies upon landing. With "For the Candy Kingdom!" players charge up to perform an attack with the Banana Guard's spear.

MultiVersus will be released on May 28, and the news anticipating the game's arrival continues coming. Before the Banana Guard, the devs revealed that the Joker is coming to MultiVersus , which will see the return of Mark Hamill as the voice of the Clown Prince of Crime. With the devs promising even more exciting news in the coming days, MultiVersus players wait to discover what other characters will be revealed, such as the teased addition of the Powerpuff Girls.

item.title: Fallout: London Will Be Released on Major PC Gaming Store
item.description:
Highlights

  • Fallout: London, a massive Fallout 4 mod, will be available on GOG after its release due to its huge 30-40 GB file size.
  • The post-apocalyptic London setting will make Fallout: London the biggest Fallout mod ever released by Team FOLON.
  • Delayed by Fallout 4's next-gen update, Fallout: London will be PC-only and is not expected to be released for consoles due to its massive file size.

The creators of the eagerly awaited Fallout 4 total conversion mod Fallout: London have recently revealed that the game will be available for download on GOG after its release. The decision to release the massive Fallout 4 mod on a store is due to the project’s huge file size, which is around 30 to 40 GB.

Fallout: London was originally revealed back in 2021 , and it’s currently being developed by a non-profit modding group called Team FOLON. The game will be set in a post-apocalyptic version of London, and it will likely be the biggest Fallout mod ever released.

Related
Fallout Fans Waiting For Fallout: London Can Check Out an Old Mod in The Meantime

The dark story of a Vault-Tec experiment gone wrong, one Fallout 4 mod can tide players over until the launch of Fallout: London's total conversion.

Now, Fallout: London ’s project lead Dean Carter told The Gamer that the mod will get an official GOG release. According to the gaming website, the team decided on GOG because it was impossible to release the project on Nexus Mods due to its massive file size. Sized at around 30 to 40 GB, Fallout: London is much bigger than total conversion mods like Fallout: The Frontier or Fallout: New California . This decision will not come without some difficulties for GOG’s marketing department, though. A GOG spokesperson revealed to The Gamer that despite Fallout: London being “a release unlike any other,” it’s hard to put it in the store and clearly indicate to customers that this is not a new game or an official DLC due to how expansive it looks.

Fallout 4's Next-Gen Update Is the Biggest Culprit of Fallout: London's Delay

According to the report, GOG was already working to bring Fallout: London to the platform even before the project’s recent delay. Originally, Fallout: London was expected to be out on April 23, releasing soon after the Amazon Prime TV show’s debut. However, Bethesda’s recent Fallout 4 next-gen update broke several mods, and Fallout: London had to be delayed until its devs make sure it’s compatible with the current version of the game.

A few weeks ago, the creators of Fallout: London commented on the Fallout 4 update . At the time, Carter voiced the studio's feelings of being "blindsided" by Bethesda's announcement and expressed frustration over the situation.

Unfortunately, while PC owners will eventually get to play Fallout: London on GOG, the same cannot be said for console gamers. Fallout: London will not be released for consoles due to its huge file size. It’s not entirely impossible that Fallout: London could eventually be available for Xbox at least, considering that Microsoft owns Bethesda, but fans should not hold their breath, as all indications lead to believing that this will be a PC-only release.

item.title: Stardew Valley Fan Is Making a Tarot Card Deck Based on the Game
item.description:
Highlights

  • Stardew Valley fans showcase creativity through fan art, modding, and unique builds outside the game.
  • A dedicated fan is crafting a tarot deck with designs based on popular characters, mobs, and plants.

A fan of Stardew Valley is going through a creative and arduous task as they build a tarot deck with designs based off of popular Stardew Valley characters, mobs, and plants. The artistic endeavor is quite clever, and the artist hopes it will eventually lead to a completed Stardew Valley deck.

Stardew Valley fans have plenty of creativity inside and outside of the game. Stardew Valley fans regularly build unique and charming designs in sheds and farmhouses, bring elements of the game to other titles like Minecraft or Stardew Valley characters to The Sims , or create fan art based on their favorite characters and places.

Related
Stardew Valley Update 1.6 Made Helpful Change Not Mentioned in the Patch Notes

An eagle-eyed Stardew Valley fan notices a helpful change in Update 1.6, adding to the growing list of surprising fixes spotted by players.

Stardew Valley Icons Become Tarot Cards

Stardew Valley player littlemooart is gradually building a tarot deck based on the game. They most recently unveiled their designs for the Suit of Swords, which they based off of enemy mobs in the game. Players who frequent Stardew Valley 's mines should be able to recognize a lot of familiar faces here, including Skeletons, Slimes, Dust Sprites, and more. The Suit of Pentacles was previously revealed to be based on the game's crops, with Ancient Fruit, Cauliflower, and other popular crops on display.

Although there are still a number of Suits left to be completed, the fan has also shared their designs for the Major Arcana cards, which seem to primarily focus on Stardew Valley 's townsfolk. The ideas are clearly based upon the NPCs' roles and characteristics in the game. The Magician is the town's Wizard, The Chariot is represented by Pam and her bus, The Hermit features Linus picking berries, and Justice is the spirit of the farmer's Grandpa. All of the cards have a clear basis that they're based upon, including clever nods to the game's mechanics, like the Stardew Valley farmer's Grandpa appearing to the player to tell them what they think of their time living there.

The clever deck by littlemooart has been in development for around three months, and with two suits remaining in the Minor Arcana, it's possible that the deck could reach completion sometime in 2024. Reception of the cards from fellow players on the subreddit have largely been positive. While not everyone who plays the game is as interested in divination as Stardew Valle y's Abigail , these would nonetheless be a charming collection to have, even if only to look at or to display as art.

With updates continuing to arrive for Stardew Valley , chances are players will be finding inspiration for creative works for the foreseeable future.

item.title: Notable Sega Leaker Weighs In on Possible Switch 2 Codename
item.description:
Highlights

  • There have been a number of rumored codenames for the Nintendo Switch's successor console.
  • Midori suggests that the possible codename for the Switch 2 could be "Ounce," based on insights about a Breath of the Wild enhancement.
  • Developers have interchangeably used names like "Switch 2" and "New Switch," but it's likely that the final name is still a secret from many.

A notable Sega leaker, Midori, weighs in on the Nintendo Switch 's successor console, along with the possible codenames that she heard. After years of rumors about a successor for Nintendo's hybrid console, Nintendo president Shuntaro Furukawa officially confirmed that the company would make an announcement regarding the Switch 2 during the fiscal year. The confirmation of the successor console has, however, resulted in a number of different rumors about the Switch successor, leading fans to speculate about a variety of things, including the console's production codename.

Claims about a codename for the Nintendo Switch successor have been a bit nebulous over the past month, with some leakers saying that the codename of the console would be "Muji," stating this name was found after digging through a Switch 2 software development kit. Some more knowledgeable Switch hackers and developers put forward the idea that the leaked "Muji" name was a placeholder in order to avoid leaking the console's real codename. That said, none of these leaks have been proven to be true yet. Notable leaker Midori, well-known for her incredibly accurate leaks of Sega games, also weighed in on the Switch 2's possible codename.

Related
Sega Leaker Teases New Nintendo Game in Development

New rumors are surfacing about an upcoming Nintendo game from a source with a good track record for leaking Persona and other Sega information.

In a recent Twitter thread, Midori addresses a previous leak of hers, where Nintendo appears to be gearing up for an enhanced version of Breath of the Wild for the new Switch system . Since the new project's internal codename has a suffix of -O, she theorizes the codename of the Switch successor console might be "Ounce," with this name stemming from how Nintendo is able to put stronger hardware onto a portable device without making it too heavy, comparing it to the Nintendo GameCube.

"Ounce" may be Switch 2 Codename, Says Midori

Midori notes that in conversations that she's heard about future Sega games on the Nintendo Switch successor , the names "Switch 2" and "New Switch" were used interchangeably, believing neither name will be used for the final console. A reply by Twitter user Aero notes that Nintendo is likely keeping the console's name close to the chest and is referring to the system as Switch 2 or other similar names, as it's easy to say. Midori says she agrees, theorizing that Nintendo likely hasn't told many developers the true name of its next hardware.

Regardless if Muji, Ounce, or even Switch 2 is the codename of Nintendo's next console, these names usually don't become the final ones. The original Nintendo Switch used the "NX" moniker before it was officially revealed in 2016, after all. Fans will need to wait until Nintendo's official reveal of the Switch successor .
